title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Nnv Brig was busliit in a braw new coat, That he, at London, frae ane Adams, got ; In's hand five taper staves as smooth's a bead, Wi' virls and whirlygigums at the head. The Goth was stalking round with anxious search, Spying the time-worn flaws in ev'ry arch ; It chanc'd his new-come neebor took his e'e, And e'en a vex'd and angry heart had he .' Wi' thieveless sneer to see his modish mein, He, down the water, gies him this guideen—
